name: Eli Lilly and Company, Appellant, v. West Chester Discount Health & Vitamin Center, Inc.
name_abbreviation: Eli Lilly & Co. v. West Chester Discount Health & Vitamin Center, Inc.

judges: Before Jones, Cohen, O’Brien and Roberts, JJ.
parties: Eli Lilly and Company, Appellant, v. West Chester Discount Health & Vitamin Center, Inc.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
This action under the Pennsylvania Fair Trade Act by a manufacturer-vendor to restrain a non-signer-retailer from selling the manufacturer’s products at prices below those stipulated in existing contracts is governed by Olin Mathieson Chemical Corp. v. White Cross Stores, Inc., 414 Pa. 95, 199 A. 2d 266 (1964).
Decree affirmed. Each party to pay own costs.
Mr. Justice Jones dissents.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Henry T. Reath, with Mm John M. Ross, G. Clinton Fogwell, Jr., and Duane, Morris & Heclcscher, and Reilly & Fogwell, for appellant.
Samuel M. Totten, with him Theodore R. Griffith, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Eli Lilly and Company, Appellant, v. West Chester Discount Health & Vitamin Center, Inc.
Argued November 19, 1963.
Before Jones, Cohen, O’Brien and Roberts, JJ.
Henry T. Reath, with Mm John M. Ross, G. Clinton Fogwell, Jr., and Duane, Morris & Heclcscher, and Reilly & Fogwell, for appellant.
Samuel M. Totten, with him Theodore R. Griffith, for appellee.
March 26, 1964:
